a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Value of 1 tonne of molybdenum¹, in constant 1998 US$ per tonne.
Data source: USGS - Historical Statistics for Mineral and Material Commodities (2023)
Note: This data is adjusted for inflation.
1. Molybdenum: Molybdenum has a very high electrical conductivity but expands very little when exposed to heat. It is used in alloys, particularly
with steel, for applications such as electric motors, and filaments in light bulbs, and in aircraft. In clean energy, it’s mostly used in solar and wind
